supporting_quotes: Diogo studied economics at Eduardo Mondlane University in Maputo. She graduated with a bachelor's degree in 1983.

organizations: School of Oriental and African Studies
roles: master's degree in financial economics graduate
supporting_quotes: She went on to obtain a master's degree in financial economics at the School of Oriental and African Studies, University of London in 1992.
PhD( University of London 2011 24 November )
Diogo began working in the Mozambique Finance Ministry in 1980 while she was still a college student.
She became head of department in 1986
and national budget director in 1989.
She then went to work for the World Bank, as the programme officer in Mozambique.
In 1994 she joined the FRELIMO government as Deputy Minister of Finance under Mozambican President Joaquim Chissano.
Before becoming prime minister, she was Minister of Planning and Finance, and she continued to hold that post until February 2005.
Minister of Economy and Finance In office 2000–2005

organizations: United Nations Commission on the Private Sector and Development
supporting_quotes: In 2003, United Nations Secretary-General Kofi Annan appointed Diogo to the United Nations Commission on the Private Sector and Development
Luísa Dias Diogo (born 11 April 1958) is a Mozambican politician who served as Prime Minister of Mozambique from February 2004 to January 2010.
In office 17 February 2004 – 16 January 2010

roles: international guest speaker at Labour Party Conference
supporting_quotes: In September 2005, Diogo was the international guest speaker at the British Labour Party Conference.

organizations: High-level Panel on United Nations Systemwide Coherence
supporting_quotes: In 2006, Annan appointed Diogo to co-chair – alongside Shaukat Aziz and Jens Stoltenberg – a High-level Panel on United Nations Systemwide Coherence

organizations: Commission on Effective Development Cooperation with Africa
supporting_quotes: She was also a member of the Commission on Effective Development Cooperation with Africa which was set up by the Prime Minister Anders Fogh Rasmussen of Denmark and held meetings between April and October 2008.
In August 2010, UN Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon appointed Diogo to the High-Level Panel on Global Sustainability
In 2014, Diogo came second to Filipe Nyusi in FRELIMO's elections for candidate in that year's general elections.

organizations: High Level Panel on the Future of the Development Assistance Committee
supporting_quotes: In 2016, Diogo was appointed by Erik Solheim, the Chairman of the Development Assistance Committee, to serve on the High Level Panel on the Future of the Development Assistance Committee
